meanings.definition: To cause (a train or tram) to leave its tracks accidentally.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain derailed the old train.
meanings.sent2: The train derailed due to a broken track.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel derailed the toy train set.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden outburst derailed the meeting's progress.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news derailed his plans for the weekend.

meanings.definition: To cause (a process or plan) to fail or go off course.
meanings.sent1: The last-minute changes derailed the project timeline.
meanings.sent2: The financial crisis derailed their expansion plans.
meanings.sent3: The noisy construction work derailed her concentration.
meanings.sent4: His lack of preparation derailed the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The sudden power outage derailed the online meeting.

meanings.definition: To go off course or deviate from the original path.
meanings.sent1: The hiker derailed from the trail and got lost.
meanings.sent2: The conversation derailed into a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke derailed into an unexpected punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her mind derailed from the task at hand to future plans.
meanings.sent5: The discussion derailed from the main topic to personal stories.
